intro: Barleria hydeana, commonly known as the narrowleaf barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and prolonged blooming period. Barleria hydeana prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders.
